problems.title: Vacuum Won't Turn On or Start
problems.description: Diagnosing why your Bissell Crosswave not spraying won't power on.
possible_causes: Battery is dead and needs replacement
solution_steps: Charge the vacuum for at least 4 hours
Look for any error lights or beeps
If completely dead, battery replacement is likely needed

required_parts.name: Bissell Crosswave not spraying Diagnostic Tool

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Bissell Crosswave not spraying?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $448 vacuum, and extending the life of your Bissell is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Bissell Crosswave not spraying needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include intermittent power and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Bissell Crosswave not spraying myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
